pt: {sc}clear{/sc} {sc}perspicuous{/sc} {sc}lucid{/sc} mean quickly and easily understood. {sc}clear{/sc} implies freedom from obscurity, ambiguity, or undue complexity.
{sc}perspicuous{/sc} applies to a style that is simple and elegant as well as clear.
{sc}lucid{/sc} suggests a clear logical coherence and evident order of arrangement.

quotes.t: The atmosphere, seen through a short space of half or three-quarters of a mile, was perfectly {qword}lucid{/qword}, but at a greater distance all colours were blended into a most beautiful haze …

"You would like me to read to you?" "You would oblige me greatly by doing so, Dorothea," said Mr. Casaubon, with a shade more meekness than usual in his polite manner. "I am wakeful: my mind is remarkably {qword}lucid{/qword}."
The stroke also set off a major crisis of presidential succession, as the debilitated and not entirely {qword}lucid{/qword} president continued to cling to office and plan feebly for re-election.
His {qword}lucid{/qword} history of this grim subject is scrupulously accurate, so far as I am able to judge …

shortdef: having full use of one's faculties : sane
